DOCNAME: CASE OF BOYCHENKO AND GERSHKOVICH v. RUSSIA
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants , Mr PERSON and PERSON PERSON , are NORP nationals , who were born in DATE and DATE respectively and live in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE issued “ Series III ” domestic hard currency bonds ( облигации внутреннего государственного валютного займа III серии ) . On DATE the first applicant acquired bonds of a total nominal value MONEY ( ORG ) and the second applicant acquired bonds of a total nominal value ORG CARDINAL .
CARDINAL . On DATE the bonds matured and the applicants presented them for redemption .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants were informed that ORG acting as the ORG 's agent refused to redeem the bonds , referring to a letter of ORG of CARDINAL DATE No . CARDINAL - CARDINAL - CARDINAL advising the holders of Series III bonds to refrain from presenting the bonds for redemption for DATE in the light of the unfavourable economic situation in the country . In the same letter the ORG undertook to negotiate restructuring of the debt during this period .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Government of GPE issued Order No . DATE which provided for the existing Series III bonds to be converted into new bonds of CARDINAL types with DATE maturity periods .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicants brought civil proceedings against the ORG , ORG and ORG seeking recovery of the nominal value of the bonds and damages . They also asked the court to defer the payment of the court fees .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Presnenskiy District Court of GPE awarded the applicants the nominal value of the bonds and dismissed the claim for damages . The first applicant was awarded ORG CARDINAL and the second applicant was awarded USD CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the appeal lodged by ORG and upheld the judgment .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants submitted writs of execution to ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG refused to comply with the writs of execution , referring to an application for supervisory review of the judgments which was to be lodged by ORG . The applicants ' request to see the application was refused .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Prosecutor of GPE lodged an application for supervisory review of the judgments .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Presidium of ORG granted the application . The ORG quashed the judgment of CARDINAL DATE and the appeal decision of DATE on the grounds that the courts had erred in interpretation of the law and failed to rule on the issue of payment of court fees , and remitted the case for a fresh examination .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG examined and dismissed the applicants ' claim in full .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG delivered an additional judgment ordering the applicants to pay court fees .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicants ' appeal against the judgment was dismissed .
CARDINAL . On DATE , following a request by the applicants , the Prosecutor of GPE lodged an application for supervisory review of the judgments .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of ORG examined the application and upheld the judgment of DATE . In the same proceedings it quashed the judgment of CARDINAL DATE concerning the payment of court fees and remitted it for a fresh examination .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG discontinued the proceedings concerning the court fees .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Deputy President of ORG of GPE lodged an application for supervisory review of the judgment in the applicants ' case .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of ORG decided to adjourn its examination of the case , apparently pending a ruling from ORG on the matter .

CARDINAL . In DATE the parties informed the ORG that the examination of the case by the ORG of ORG was adjourned in connection with a case pending before ORG of GPE which concerned a similar issue . Since then the parties provided no information to the ORG about the development of the case .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of the Code of Civil Procedure of DATE ( Гражданский процессуальный кодекс РСФСР ) , as in force at the relevant time , provided that regional and higher courts could conduct supervisory review of the activities of the lower courts .

CARDINAL . According to Sections CARDINAL , CARDINAL and CARDINAL of the Code , certain senior judicial officers could , at any time , at request of the person concerned or on their own motion , lodge with a higher court an application for supervisory review of a final decision of a lower court on points of law and procedure .
